p: These are known as the buttercup family and are predominantly herbaceous annual and perennial plants. The family includes also some woody vines and prefers moist habitats. They commonly have rhizomes or tubers. Several alkaloids, glycosides, and saponins are frequently found in the sap. There are more than 1800 species and around 50 genera, mainly found in temperate and cold areas of the northern hemisphere. The group is widely distributed as ornamental plants in gardens. Some of the most popular genera are Aconitum, Aquilegia, Anemone, Ranunculus, and Nigella.
